title: Hear from Ukrainians living amid Russian shelling
description: CNN's Sam Kiley goes to Severodonetsk, Ukraine, a frontline city in the war with Russia, to talk to Ukrainians desperate for resources as they live amid Russian shelling.

title: Hillary Clinton's tribute draws applause at Madeleine Albright's funeral
description: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton paid tribute to Madeleine Albright, who served as the first female Secretary of State under President Bill Clinton, at Albright's memorial in Washington, DC.

title: What to know about Transnistria, the Russian-backed territory that Putin may be eyeing after Ukraine
description: A series of unexplained explosions have occurred in parts of Transnistria, a breakaway territory within Moldova that has housed Russian troops for decades, sparking fears that Moscow's war could soon stretch beyond Ukraine and create a new theater of conflict in eastern Europe.

title: Can Europe cope if Russia cuts more supplies?
description: Russia has started to turn off the supply of natural gas to Europe, making good on a threat to halt deliveries to "unfriendly" countries that refuse to make payments in rubles.

title: Boeing delays its newest jet as losses soar
description: The bad news keeps piling up for Boeing. The company is delaying the debut of its newest passenger jet to 2025, and it reported a much bigger-than-expected quarterly loss.

title: Betty White's LA home goes on sale for over $10.5 million
description: The longtime home of late Hollywood star Betty White is up for sale, with a price a shade over $10.5 million.

title: Trump appeals civil contempt order and $10,000 daily fine
Kerry warns world will blow through critical climate change threshold unless global leaders step up
description: US Climate Envoy John Kerry warned Wednesday that world leaders will blow through a critical climate-change threshold unless they dramatically accelerate the transition to clean energy.

title: 'Perfect storm' of disease ahead with vaccines delayed and measles cases up, WHO and UNICEF say
description: The World Health Organization and the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund warned of an increased risk of measles spread, with worldwide cases up nearly 80% so far in 2022 compared with 2021.

title: The chasm between Moscow and its adversaries is widening, dimming the prospects for diplomacy
description: As the war in Ukraine grinds into its third month, the prospects of any kind of negotiated peace have never seemed more remote.

title: James Gunn defends Chris Pratt against call to replace him in 'Guardians of the Galaxy'
description: "Guardians of the Galaxy" director James Gunn is defending Chris Pratt in the face of social media chatter that he should be replaced as the star of the franchise.

title: Steph Curry launches all-expenses paid golf tour for young underrepresented players
description: NBA star Steph Curry has announced a new golf tour aimed at providing a competitive, all-expenses paid opportunity for underrepresented young players.

title: Model Quannah Chasinghorse: 'If you want to work with me, you have to work with all of me'
description: Despite being into fashion since I was young, I never once thought that I could be a model. I am a proud member of the Hän Gwich'in and Sičangu/Oglala Lakota tribes in the US -- but like most Indigenous teenagers, I grew up without any representation in pop culture. I didn't feel confident or even like the way I looked.

title: China's Xi calls for 'all-out' infrastructure splurge to rescue economy
Robert Pattinson set to return for a sequel to 'The Batman'
description: "The Batman" will return.

title: The US is out of the Covid-19 pandemic phase, Fauci says
Jerusalem violence puts century-old status quo to the test
description: A recent spike in violence at some of Jerusalem's key holy sites has left Jordan in a difficult position vis-a-vis its nearly century-old custodial obligations in the city.

title: 'Does not give Russia the right to attack': Blinken pushes back on Republican senator
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken forcefully pushed back when Republican Sen. Rand Paul of Kentucky pointed out that Ukraine and Georgia were once part of the Soviet Union as Paul appeared to raise Moscow's alleged rationale about the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: My infertility journey nearly broke me, but it was worth it
description: It was 6:30 p.m., and I was exhausted. I'd been up on television at 5 a.m. and after an hour commute home, my husband and I had a chaotic dinner with our two kids followed by bath time.

title: Tourists crash drones into Italy landmarks in Rome and Pisa
description: An out-of-control drone operated by a tourist crashed onto the roof of Rome's historic Palazzo Venezia on April 23, in Italy's third such drone-related incident this month.

title: China's Xi tries to rescue the economy
description: • Analysis: China grapples with challenges

title: Margot Robbie's 'Barbie' movie look revealed in first teaser image
description: Life in plastic is certainly looking fantastic for Margot Robbie, as Warner Bros. teased Barbie fans with a glimpse of its upcoming new movie.

title: Megan Fox has a blood drinking ritual with Machine Gun Kelly and thinks social media is 'sinister'
description: Megan Fox would like to clear up what people think about her and fiancé Machine Gun Kelly drinking each other's blood.

title: Final frontier: How to plan and what to expect on a cruise to Antarctica
description: Travelers to Antarctica always remember the first place they planted their feet on the frozen continent. For me, it was Portal Point, a narrow tip of land jutting westward from the Peninsula just north of the Antarctic Circle.

title: Palestinian farmer finds 4,500-year-old goddess statue while working his land
description: A Palestinian farmer working his land in Gaza has uncovered the head of a 4,500-year-old statue of Canaanite goddess Anat.

title: These maps show how natural gas is behind Russia's power
description: It is not just with military might that Russia impacts the world, the country has vast oil and gas reserves. With much of Europe relying on Russian gas, Putin's pipeline diplomacy now has its sights on China.

title: Sorry, crypto fans. Gold is still the real hedge in times of uncertainty
description: It looks like bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies may not be digital gold after all.

title: Why tech stocks are bleeding right now
description: The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite was a huge beneficiary of the stock market's epic recovery from the pandemic. Now, it's facing ever deeper losses as investors fear that fast-growing companies are running out of steam.

title: Why lab-grown diamond sales are surging
description: It's proposal season, and engagements are on the rise. So are factory-made diamond sales.

title: Buenos Aires: The city where every open space is a dance floor
description: It's the South American capital that truly stands out. A result of its rich immigrant past and geographical remoteness, way below the equator, Buenos Aires is unlike anywhere else on this diverse and beautiful continent.

title: Manchester City and Real Madrid play out Champions League classic
description: It was a match which will be remembered as a Champions League classic. There were seven goals, one an outrageous penalty, plenty of chances and outstanding performances as Manchester City and Real Madrid played out a thrilling 4-3 first-leg semifinal tie Tuesday.

title: Watch SpaceX's latest launch to International Space Station
description: SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket and Crew Dragon spacecraft have launched the second astronaut mission for SpaceX in just one month. On board are four professional astronauts, destined for the International Space Station, including the first Black woman to join the ISS crew.

title: Russia's threat to retaliate against US-Japan naval exercises shows it's getting jumpy, analysts say
description: Russia has warned Japan of "retaliatory measures" if it expands joint naval exercises with the United States near Russia's eastern borders.

title: Shakhtar Donetsk: Football club has lost its home again. Now it tours Europe raising money for war effort in Ukraine
description: When Russia began its invasion of Ukraine on the morning of February 24, Darijo Srna was awoken at 6 a.m. by the sound of air raid sirens.

title: Novak Djokovic to defend Wimbledon title as organizers allow unvaccinated players to compete
description: Novak Djokovic will be able to defend his Wimbledon title this summer after tournament organizers said that players who are unvaccinated against Covid-19 can compete at the All England Lawn Tennis Club (AELTC).

title: Chinese teachers among 4 killed in Pakistan university blast
description: Three teachers from China and a driver have been killed in a suspected suicide bombing near a Chinese language learning center in Pakistan's largest city, Karachi.

title: SpaceX launches another historic astronaut mission
description: A SpaceX rocket and spacecraft took off Wednesday morning carrying four astronauts destined for the International Space Station, including the first Black woman to join the ISS crew.

title: Open-source encyclopedia puts 10,000 years of Indian art history in one place
description: From prehistoric Bhimbetka cave paintings to works by contemporary art stars like Atul Dodiya and Shilpa Gupta, India has a rich cultural heritage dating back over 10,000 years.

title: Over 120,000 lbs of ground beef products recalled due to E. coli contamination fears
description: A US company is recalling more than 120,000 pounds of ground beef products over fears they may be contaminated with E. coli bacteria, the US Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) says.

title: What goes into the healing power of an 'Encanto' arepa? A Colombian chef reveals its magic
description: "You just healed my hand with an arepa con queso," Mirabel Madrigal tells her mother, Julieta, in the movie "Encanto," while holding a cheesy arepa -- a round corn cake.

title: Derek Chauvin appeals his murder conviction in the death of George Floyd
description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin has asked the state Court of Appeals to overturn his conviction for the 2020 murder of George Floyd, according to an appeal filed Monday.

title: Singapore executes intellectually disabled man for drug trafficking after rejecting appeal
Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi handed five year jail term for corruption
description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentenced deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi to five years in jail on Wednesday after finding her guilty in the first of 11 corruption cases against her, according to a source with knowledge of proceedings.

title: Houston Dash suspends head coach James Clarkson amid league-wide investigation into claims of misconduct
description: Women's professional soccer team Houston Dash suspended its head coach and general manager James Clarkson after reviewing the initial findings of an investigation into league-wide allegations of wrongdoing, the team announced on Twitter Tuesday.

title: Mom captures terrifying moment shots were fired near a youth baseball game
description: Lori Ferguson captured the panic in the air as the sound of gunshots rang from the parking lot of a youth baseball game in South Carolina.

title: Prosecutor shares new images of horrors in Bucha
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reports on newly released images from Bucha, Ukraine as prosecutor's attempt to build a case of war crimes by Russia.

title: Who is Putin's reputed girlfriend Alina Kabaeva?
description: CNN's Nic Robertson reports on Alina Kabaeva, a woman linked to Russian President Vladimir Putin.
